text: A 75-year-old woman presents to her general practitioner because of sleep difficulty and fatigue. Over the past 6 months, she has had difficulty initiating sleep at night. She estimates she takes on average 1 hour to fall asleep. She reports that she then sleeps for 4 - 5 hours a night and wakes up early in the morning unintentionally. She states that she often lays in bed and stares at the ceiling fan without much motivation to start her day. During this period, she has had decreased appetite and lost interest in her hobbies such as gardening. These symptoms developed since her husband's death earlier this year. She lives alone and she feels guilty about being a burden to the rest of her family. On examination, she has a flat, restricted affect. She is in the healthy BMI range and has no underlying co- morbidities. Cognitive tests were unremarkable. Which one of the following is the most appropriate initial management? Choose the single best answer.
